Name: Three Wine Jar Seals
Description: The three seals were used as stoppers for three large pottery jars, which contained a residue of evaporated wine. The seals are made of rush and mud and are inscribed in relief with the source and quality of the wine. The writing on two of them say "sweet wine from the house of Aten life." These wine-jar seals enable us to make a list of the various vineyards and the qualities of wine at that time. It also provides proof that wine was consumed and that the wine industry was important in Ancient Egypt.
